title.narrative: Integrated Clearance of Conventional Weapons in Northern Iraq

description.narrative: This project will enable safe access to productive land contaminated by ERW and landmines, promoting socio economic development in Iraq. By removing the threat from ERW and landmines, the physical threat of death or injury to vulnerable populations will be decreased. In the current emergency context, the following project activities will benefit not only local communities but also IDPs and refugees, who are currently at risk while transiting through and residing in contaminated areas where their knowledge of the potential risks may be limited. MAG will deploy five Mine Action Teams (60 months total), one Conventional Weapons Disposal Team (12 months), one Mine Detection Dog team (12 months), one Mine Detection Dog Support team (12 months), one Mechanical team (12 months), one Mechanical Support team (12 months), and two survey teams (12 months) to clear and hand back to communities 974,000m2 of land for productive use, benefitting 21,000 people across Sulimaniyah, Kirkuk and Dohuk governorates.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity

sector.narrative: Conflict Prevention and Resolution/Peace and Security
